text: Lone Survivor starring Mark Wahlberg was
one of the most popular movies of 2013
it tells the true story of Navy SEAL
Marcus Latrell who was wounded in a
firefight with the Taliban near the
border of Pakistan for those who haven't
seen the movie in IT latrell's company
is on a mission in Afghanistan when
they're spotted by a couple of goat
herders they make the decision to let
these civilians go rather than killing
them but the goat herders informed the
local Taliban forces of the American
soldiers presence and they end up
getting attacked tr's entire company is
killed except for himself who has a
badly broken back and wounded leg at
this point he was taken in by a local
man named Mohammad gulab who helped to
hide him from the Taliban until the US
military could come rescue him but
trell's story quickly became a
best-selling book in America however
this put Muhammad gab's life at risk
with the Taliban who were now Angry with
him for Sheltering an American there
were multiple attempts made on gab's
life and he began to consider moving to
America America in 2012 his nephew was
shot in the head in an attack that was
intended for him and at this point he
gets in contact with Marcus Latrell and
ends up going to America the Lone
Survivor movie was set to come out soon
and gulab and Latrell spent most of
their time together promoting it doing
Red Carpet Events and whatnot Latrell
even offered to help get gulab a green
card so he could stay in America
permanently which gulab was hesitant to
accept because he still wanted to return
home at some point at this point gulab
had never read the Lone Survivor book
because he didn't speak English but
during his time in America a translator
was able to brief him on the specifics
of the book and he said hey a few of the
things in this book didn't happen like
that in real life first of all the
American soldiers didn't let the goat
herders go they were attacked by the
Taliban while still deciding what to do
with them secondly gulab said there's no
evidence that 35 to 50 Taliban soldiers
were killed by the Americans as Latrell
had claimed in fact no Taliban bodies
had been found and this was confirmed by
Andrew mcmanis a former Marine Colonel
who helped search the area after the
battle additionally Latrell was fully
stocked when gulab found him having 11
fully loaded magazines which suggests
that he didn't fire as many shots as he
said in the book Latrell also claimed
that he was on a mission to hunt an
international terrorist with close
connections to Osama Bin Laden when in
fact the group they were hunting had no
direct connections to bin Laden and were
just a small militia with some ties to
the Taliban Latrell also estimated that
there were 80 to 200 Taliban fighters
who attacked him and his company whereas
gulab said it was closer to eight or 10
video evidence of the event seems to
confirm gulab side of the story as only
seven Shia militants are pictured gulab
brought up these issues to Latrell right
before they were supposed to go on 60
Minutes to do an interview and Latrell
became angry with him gulab was then
instructed by a translator to go along
with whatever story that Latrell gave in
the interview in that 60 Minutes
interview Latrell would change his story
slightly from the one in the book
claiming that there were only 30 to 40
militants rather than 80 to 200 after
the movie's promotion was finished gulab
was deported back to Afghanistan with
the movie now in theaters putting an
even bigger Target on his head with the
Taliban the green card that Latrell had
promised him never materializing since
that time gulab has been On The Run
moving from place to place in order to
avoid the attacks on his life recently
he was finally able to obtain a visa to
the United States and he now lives in
Fort Worth Texas Marcus Latrell has
ignored all of his efforts to contact
him gulab is still incredibly bitter
towards Latrell and says I'll never
regret saving Marcus but I regret what I
did to help the movie I pray that one
day Marcus tells America the truth so
yeah an interesting true story behind a
war hero manufactured by Hollywood the
SE pro-war propaganda movies like Lone
Survivor and American Sniper rarely ever
tell the full truth and their main
purpose is to lionize and promote the US
military and in this case it allowed
Marcus Latrell to rake in millions of
dollars off of his story while the man
who saved him had his life thrown into
chaos
